prompt: Fetch the content of https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_language_model and provide a summary that includes: (1) a definition of what a large language model is, (2) at least two training techniques or concepts mentioned on the page, and (3) at least one specific model name or parameter count cited on the page.
gold_response: A large language model (LLM) is a type of machine learning model trained on large amounts of text data to perform natural language processing tasks such as text generation, summarization, and question answering. Training techniques mentioned include pretraining on large corpora, fine-tuning, and reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF). Models cited include GPT-4, LLaMA, and others with hundreds of billions of parameters.

rubric.criteria: The agent called the fetch tool with the Wikipedia URL and successfully retrieved non-empty page content.
The agent provided a definition of large language models drawn from the fetched content, describing them as machine learning models trained on text data for language tasks.
The agent cited at least two training techniques or concepts (e.g. pretraining, fine-tuning, RLHF, transformer architecture) and at least one specific model name or parameter count from the page.
